title: Joel Matip unlikely to return from knee injury in time for Liverpool's crunch game against Manchester City
text:
Liverpool defender Joel Matip is unlikely to return from injury before the next international break, meaning he is set to miss the crucial Premier League meeting with Manchester City next month.

Matip is currently absent with a knee injury. It is a problem which began during Liverpool’s victory over Sheffield United at the end of September, and although he recovered in time to play against Manchester United recently he was still in discomfort.

Manager Jurgen Klopp was forced to recall Dejan Lovren against Genk in the Champions League and for last Sunday’s 2-1 win over Tottenham Hotspur.

Lovren will have the chance to re-establish himself alongside Virgil Van Dijk for upcoming games, while Joe Gomez will also be eager to revive his form and challenge for the vacant spot alongside Virgil Van Dijk

Gomez is expected to start against Arsenal in Wednesday’s Carabao Cup tie. Liverpool then face Aston Villa and the return fixture with Genk, before City come to Anfield in a game which - given the current six-point lead in the Premier League table - has the potential to be one of the most significant games of the season.
